Detailed Description

provides a table with basic cut/paste facilities

This class provides a QTable with cut/paste/copy facilities, see the QT documentation for further details about QTable.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum cfg_Table::validData
 

enum of return values for validData

Enumerator:
DATA_VALID  This row is valid
DATA_INVALID  This row is invalid, return to previous contents
DATA_ALL_VALID  All rows are valid, do not ask again
CANCEL  Cancel the paste, and retunr all rows to previous states

Member Function Documentation

void cfg_Table::clipBoardDataChanged (   )  [protected, slot]
 

The function cfg_Table::clipBoardDataChanged() checks to see if the clipboard data is valid to paste, then emits signal clipboardDataValid, this can be connected to enable menu items.

Returns:
void

void cfg_Table::clipboardDataValid (  bool   )  [signal]
 

Signal issued when the data on the clipboard has changed, indicating if it is suitable to paste, or not.

void cfg_Table::copyToClipboard (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_Table::copyToClipboard() copies the selected items to the clipboard

Returns:
void

void cfg_Table::dataPasted (   )  [signal]
 

Signal issued when data has been pasted, allowing the application to check the table, at this point undoPaste() can be called if the changes need o be undone.

void cfg_Table::deleteItems (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_Table::deleteItems() deletes the currently selected items

Returns:
void

void cfg_Table::pasteClipboard (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_Table::pasteClipboard() copies the data on the clipboard to the currently selected item. If there are not enough items selected the user will be prompted to confirm that the selection should be increased, if only one item is selected rows below the current item will automatically be selected.

As each row is modified the function validateRow(int iRow) is called, this can be used to check the row as it is inserted. When all the data has been pasted the signal dataPasted() will be emmited, at that point you may want to call undoPaste() if the table is not valid anymore.

Returns:
void

void cfg_Table::undoPaste (   )  [slot]
 

The function cfg_Table::undoPaste() undoes the last paste operation.

Returns:
void

int cfg_Table::validateRow (  int  iRow  )  [protected, virtual]
 

The function cfg_Table::validateRow(int iRow) is the default function to validate row, that can be overriden by a class that inherits this class to perform application specific validation. This function returns cfg_Table::validData.

Parameters:
int iRow The row that needs validating
Returns:
int This should be cfg_Table::validData.
